citeinfo.title: Digital Elevation Model, 0.5 m, Barrow Environmental Observatory, Alaska, 2012

descript.abstract: This 0.5m horizontal resolution digital elevation model, DEM, was developed from Airborne Laser Altimetry flown by Aerometric Inc, now know as Quantum Spatial, Inc. on 12 August, 2012. One Mission was flown and the data jointly processed with LANL personnel to produce a 0.5m DEM covering a region approximately 2.8km wide and 12.5km long extending from the coast above North Salt Lagoon to south of Gas Well Road. This DEM encompasses a diverse range of hyrdrologic, geomorphic, geophysical and biological features typical of the Barrow Penninsula. Vertical accuracy at the 95% confidence interval was computed as 0.145m. The coordinate system, datum, and geoid for this DEM are UTM Zone 4N, NAD83 (2011), NAVD88 (GEOID09). http://dx.doi.org/10.5440/1109234; DOI:10.5440/1109234
descript.purpose: 0.5m LiDAR dataset acquired for an area near Barrow, Alaska on 12 August, 2012. Data were collected to improved characterization of key landscape elevation features such as polygonal terrain and hydrologic drainage features. This DEM encompasses a diverse range of hyrdrologic, geomorphic, geophysical and biological features typical of the Barrow Peninsula.

idinfo.useconst: Use of this data recommends the user collaborates with the NGEE LiDAR data PI, Cathy Wilson, and involve her as a co-author on presentations and publications resulting from its use.

cntaddr.address: MS J495, SM-30 Bikini Atoll Rd

qattracc.attraccv: Vertical accuracy at the 95% confidence interval was computed as 0.145m. The coordinate system, datum, and geoid for this DEM are UTM Zone 4N, NAD83 (2011), NAVD88 (GEOID09).

dataqual.logic: Data are considered of good quality in the context of the information presented in the abstract. Users are advised to read the rest of the metadata record carefully for additional details.
dataqual.complete: Data are considered complete in the context of the information presented in the abstract. Users are advised to read the rest of the metadata record carefully for additional details.

procstep.procdesc: We used 285 checkpoints acquired by UMIAQ to compute the vertical accuracy. The computed RMSE at the 95th percentile confidence interval was 0.145 meters, meeting the general LiDAR data vertical accuracy specifications. This analysis was carried out by Chandana Gangodagamage at the Los Alamos National Laboratory.

cntperp.cntorg: Next-Generation Ecosystem Experiments (NGEE) Arctic Project, Oak Ridge National Laboratory

metainfo.metstdn: FDGC Content Standard for Digital Geospatial Metadata and Biological Data Profile

ome.datause: This data can be used for visual or computational analysis of 3D terrain. The coordinate system, datum, and geoid for this DEM are UTM Zone 4N, NAD83 (2011), NAVD88 (GEOID09).
